definition: Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution
(classical) a type of battle-ax/to kill/to slaughter
surname Liu
few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom
young
odd (number)
strange/odd/weird/wonderful/surprisingly/unusually

sentences.english: Now in front of us we can see Comrade Liu Shaoqi's former residence.
sentences.chinese: 大家現在看到的是劉少奇同志舊居。

sentences.english: Liu Shaoqi was very good at economic construction and Party's construction.
sentences.chinese: 劉少奇同志最擅長經濟建設和黨建工作。

sentences.english: Comrade Liu Shaoqi made this clear in his report.
sentences.chinese: 這個問題，在劉少奇同志的報告中已經講了。

definition: Luo Ronghuan (1902-1963), Chinese communist military leader
He Long (1896-1969), important communist military leader, died from persecution during the Cultural Revolution
Hua Guofeng (1921-2008), leader of Chinese Communist Party after the Cultural Revolution

Military Commission of the Communist Party Central Committee
United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972
Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong
Ye Ting (1896-1946), communist military leader
War of Liberation (1945-49), after which the Communists 共產黨武裝|共产党武装 under Mao Zedong 毛澤東|毛泽东 took over from the Nationalists 國民政府|国民政府 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
Yang Hucheng (1893-1949), Chinese warlord and Nationalist general
Korean War (1950-1953)
Communist International or Comintern (1919-1943), also known as the Third International 第三國際|第三国际[Di4 san1 Guo2 ji4]
Zhang Shizhao (1881-1973), revolutionary journalist in Shanghai, then established writer
Zhang Guotao (1897-1979), Chinese communist leader in the 1920s and 1930s, defected to Guomindang in 1938
Chen Yun (1905-1995), communist leader and economist
